titleInfo.title: Foreman et al v. Heineman et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER granting 35 Motion to Extend Time to Respond. After a Telephonic Conference was held, IT IS HEREBY ORDERED: 1. The defendants' motion for enlargement of time, filing 35, is granted. The defendants are given until February 1, 2006 to respond to the plaintiffs' filing 11 motion for class certification. Discovery schedule implemented. Signed by Magistrate Judge David L. Piester on 11/2/2005. (JAR)

titleInfo.title: Foreman et al v. Heineman et al
titleInfo.subTitle: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER regarding Motion to Dismiss70, and Stipulation75. IT IS ORDERED: 1. The parties' "Stipulation Regarding Scheduling" (filing 75), construed as a motion to enlarge response times, is granted in part as follows;2. Plaintiffs shall file their opposition to the defendants' Motion to Dismiss(filing 70) on or before April 14, 2006; 3. Defendants shall file their reply, if any, in further support of their Motion to Dismiss on or before May 5, 2006;4. The Clerk of Court shall adjust the court's computerized record-keepingsystem to reflect that the "response due" date on the defendants' Motionto Dismiss (filing 70) is now May 5, 2006; 5. Magistrate Judge Piester shall rule on the portion of the parties' "Stipulation Regarding Scheduling" (filing 75) pertaining to the plaintiffs' Motion for Class Certification and Appointment of Class Counsel (filing 11). Signed by Judge Richard G. Kopf on 3/15/2006. (JAR)

titleInfo.title: Foreman et al v. Heineman et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER granting 75 Stipulation. IT IS HEREBY ORDERED the parties' stipulation, filing 75, insofar as it relates to the deadlines for responses to the pending motions for class certification and appointment of class counsel, is granted and the parties shall comply with the following scheduling dates: Plaintiffs shall serve and file any reply papers in further support of Plaintiffs' Motion forClass Certification and Appointment of Class Counsel (Filing 11) on or before March 31, 2006. Signed by Magistrate Judge David L. Piester on 3/16/2006. (JAR, )

Signed by Magistrate Judge David L. Piester on 3/16/2006. (JAR, )

titleInfo.subTitle: REPORT AND RECOMMENDATION to the Honorable Richard G. Kopf regarding MOTION to Dismiss70, and MOTION to Certify Class11. The parties are notified that a failure to file an objection to this recommendation as provided in the local rules of this court may be held to be a waiver of any right to appeal the court's adoption of the recommendation.Ordered by Magistrate Judge David L. Piester (JAR)

titleInfo.title: Foreman et al v. Heineman et al
titleInfo.subTitle: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER - The parties' Stipulation Regarding Scheduling (filing 91 ) is granted. Either party shall serve and file any Statement of Objection to the Magistrate Judge's August 16, 2006, Report and Recommendation (filing 90 ) on or before September 29, 2006. Briefs opposing such objections shall be filed on or before November 13, 2006. Reply briefs, if any, shall be served and filed on or before November 30, 2006. The Clerk of Court shall adjust the court's internal computerized recordkeeping system to reflect that the "Response Due" date on Filing 11 (Motion to Certify Class), Filing 70 (Motion to Dismiss), and Filing 90 (Report and Recommendation) is November 30, 2006. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf (GJG, )

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 4:05-cv-03241; Foreman et al v. Heineman et al;
extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER - The parties' Stipulation Regarding Scheduling (filing 91 ) is granted. Either party shall serve and file any Statement of Objection to the Magistrate Judge's August 16, 2006, Report and Recommendation (filing 90 ) on or before September 29, 2006. Briefs opposing such objections shall be filed on or before November 13, 2006. Reply briefs, if any, shall be served and filed on or before November 30, 2006. The Clerk of Court shall adjust the court's internal computerized recordkeeping system to reflect that the "Response Due" date on Filing 11 (Motion to Certify Class), Filing 70 (Motion to Dismiss), and Filing 90 (Report and Recommendation) is November 30, 2006. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf (GJG, )

titleInfo.title: Foreman et al v. Heineman et al
titleInfo.subTitle: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER regarding pending motions. IT IS ORDERED: 1. The Magistrate Judge's Recommendations (filing 90) that Plaintiffs' Motion for Class Certification and Appointment of Class Counsel (filing 11) be denied and that Defendants' Motion to Dismiss (filing 70) be granted on the ground that this court should abstain from hearing Plaintiffs' claims under Younger v. Harris, 401 U.S. 37 (1971), are adopted; 2. Plaintiffs' Motion for Class Certification and Appointment of Class Counsel (filing 11) is denied; 3. Defendants' Motion to Dismiss (filing 70) is granted on the ground that this court should abstain from hearing Plaintiffs' claims under Younger v. Harris, 401 U.S. 37 (1971); 4. The parties' objections (filings 93&96) to the Magistrate Judge's Report and Recommendation are denied; 5. Defendants' Motion to Strike Plaintiffs' Index of Supplemental Authorities (filing 100) is denied as moot, as the court did not consider the supplementary material; and 6. By separate document, judgment shall be entered dismissing this case on the basis of abstention under Younger v. Harris, 401 U.S. 37 (1971). Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. (JAR)

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 4:05-cv-03241; Foreman et al v. Heineman et al;

Harris, 401 U.S. 37 (1971), are adopted; 2. Plaintiffs' Motion for Class Certification and Appointment of Class Counsel (filing 11) is denied; 3. Defendants' Motion to Dismiss (filing 70) is granted on the ground that this court should abstain from hearing Plaintiffs' claims under Younger v. Harris, 401 U.S. 37 (1971); 4. The parties' objections (filings 93&96) to the Magistrate Judge's Report and Recommendation are denied; 5. Defendants' Motion to Strike Plaintiffs' Index of Supplemental Authorities (filing 100) is denied as moot, as the court did not consider the supplementary material; and 6. By separate document, judgment shall be entered dismissing this case on the basis of abstention under Younger v. Harris, 401 U.S. 37 (1971). Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. (JAR)
